DOC.brief_title: Diagnostic Study Adrenal Cortical Function Children With Septic Shock
DOC.detailed_description: PROTOCOL OUTLINE : Patients undergo corticotropin stimulation test within 8 hour admission PICU . Blood sample plasma cortisol corticotropin level draw time 0 follow corticotropin 1-24 IV . Additional cortisol level draw 30 60 minute . Corticotropin measure immunoradiometric assay cortisol measure radioimmunoassay . Mean arterial blood pressure , heart rate , respiratory rate record baseline 60 minute . Patients receive routine management septic shock multiple organ system failure .
DOC.criteria: PROTOCOL ENTRY CRITERIA : Disease Characteristics Patients admit PICU septic shock ; Hypotension ( systolic blood pressure le 2 standard deviation age normal ) plus 3 following : temperature great 38 less 36 degree Celsius ; heart rate great 90th percentile age ; respiratory rate great 90th percentile age ; WBC great 12,000/mm3 less 4,000/mm3 great 10 % band form ; perfusion abnormality include lactic acidosis , oliguria , acute alteration mental status Arterial central venous catheter place Prior/Concurrent Therapy At least one month since prior corticosteroid Patient Characteristics Renal : No nephrotic syndrome require glucocorticoid Pulmonary : No asthma require glucocorticoid Other : No condition require glucocorticoid ( e.g. , adrenal insufficiency ) ; No uncontrolled diabetes mellitus ; No prior adrenal dysfunction ( plasma cortisol concentration le 19 mcg/dL 30 60 minute post corticotropin stimulation ) ; No hypersensitivity corticotropin
